Description: (v8.7) AWS CFT to deploy a FortiManager HA pair into an existing VPC

Label.default: Interface IP Configuration for the Cluster

VPCCIDR.Description: Provide a network CIDR for the VPC
VPCCIDR.ConstraintDescription: must be a valid CIDR block format.

FortiManager1PrimaryIP.Description: Provide the primary IP address in CIDR form for FortiManager1 to use (IP from PublicOrPrivateSubnet1)
FortiManager1PrimaryIP.ConstraintDescription: must be a valid CIDR block format.

FortiManager2PrimaryIP.Description: Provide the primary IP address in CIDR form for FortiManager2 to use (IP from PublicOrPrivateSubnet2)
FortiManager2PrimaryIP.ConstraintDescription: must be a valid CIDR block format.

ClusterIP.Description: Provide the secondary IP address in CIDR form for the Cluster to use (IP from PublicOrPrivateSubnet1)
ClusterIP.ConstraintDescription: must be a valid CIDR block format.

PubliclyAvailable.Description: Select 'Yes' if the FMG will have an EIP to be publicly available or not.  *** If you select 'No', then an S3 endpoint needs to be deployed and reachable from the subnet the FortiManagers are in to successfully bootstrap.  Also, the FortiManagers require internet access to communicate with FortiCare successfully for license validation. ***

S3EndpointDeployment.Description: Select if a new S3 Endpoint should be deployed or not. If you are using public subnets and 'PubliclyAvailable' is 'Yes' then select UseExisting.  *** If the FortiManagers does not have direct internet access, an S3 Endpoint should be used and associated to the subnet the FortiManagers will be deployed in for successful bootstrapping. Also, the FortiManagers require internet access to communicate with FortiCare successfully for license validation. ***

SubnetRouteTableID.Description: If a new S3 Endpoint is to be deployed, provide the route table ID associated with the subnet the FortiManagers will be deployed in.

InstanceType.Description: Select the instance type for the FortiManagers.  *** If using PAYG2Devices for LicenseType, you can only use up to a m5.xlarge. Check current Marketplace listings for PAYG options to confirm instance type selected is supported. ***

CIDRForInstanceAccess.Description: Provide a network CIDR from which the FortiManager instances will be accessed

KeyPair.Description: Select a keypair to associate with the FortiManagers

EncryptVolumes.Description: Select 'true' to encrypt the FortiManager instances OS and Log volumes with your account's KMS default master key for EBS.  Otherwise select false to leave unencrypted

InitS3Bucket.Description: [BYOL Only, leave blank otherwise] Provide the Init S3 Bucket name, where your config files will be created  *** the bucket should exist in the same region as this deployment for successful bootstrapping ***

FortiManagerVersion.Description: Select the verion of FortiManager to use (latest GA AMI will be used)

LicenseType.Description: Select the license type for the FortiManagers

FortiManager1SerialNumber.Description: [BYOL & Flex Only, leave blank for PAYG] Provide the serial number for FortiManager1 that matches it's license (ie FMG-VMTM00000001)

FortiManager2SerialNumber.Description: [BYOL & Flex Only, leave blank for PAYG] Provide the serial number for FortiManager2 that matches it's license (ie FMG-VMTM00000002)

FortiManager1LicenseFile.Description: [BYOL Only, leave blank for otherwise] Provide the name of the BYOL license file in the Init S3 Bucket for FortiManager1 (ie fmg1.lic or prefix/fmg1.lic)

FortiManager2LicenseFile.Description: [BYOL Only, leave blank for otherwise] Provide the name of the BYOL license file in the Init S3 Bucket for FortiManager2 (ie fmg2.lic or prefix/fmg2.lic)

FortiManager1FortiFlexToken.Description: [Flex Only, leave blank otherwise] Provide the FortiFlex Token for FortiManager1 (ie 1A2B3C4D5E6F7G8H9I0J)

FortiManager2FortiFlexToken.Description: [Flex Only, leave blank otherwise] Provide the FortiFlex Token for FortiManager2 (ie 2B3C4D5E6F7G8H9I0J1K)

SecurityGroupIngress.Description: Allow local VPC access to Fmg
Allow 10.0.0.0/8 access to tcp port 541 Fmg
Allow 172.16.0.0/12 access to tcp port 541 Fmg
Allow 192.168.0.0/16 access to tcp port 541 Fmg
Allow 10.0.0.0/8 access to tcp port 514 Fmg
Allow 172.16.0.0/12 access to tcp port 514 Fmg
Allow 192.168.0.0/16 access to tcp port 514 Fmg
Allow 10.0.0.0/8 access to udp port 514 Fmg
Allow 172.16.0.0/12 access to udp port 514 Fmg
Allow 192.168.0.0/16 access to udp port 514 Fmg

Properties.Description: Allow FMGs to access each other (ICMP, VRRP, etc)

Fn::Join: logger.info('--> found latest AMI: {}, {}, {} {}'.format(ami_dict[ami_list[0]], ami_list[0], searchString, productCode))
logger.error('!!--> Unable to find AMI {} {} in describe_images response! {}'.format(searchString, productCode, resp))
responseData = {'msg':'Unable to find AMI {} {} in describe_images response! {}'.format(searchString, productCode,resp)}
if fmg1_result is True and fmg2_result is True:

Password.Value: The instance ID of each FortiManager
